snippet: Benjamin Netanyahu, the Israeli prime minister, said Israel and Germany remained close friends despite their disagreement over the settlements.
abstract: Israeli Prime Min Benjamin Netanyahu, during visit to Germany, says he intends to continue with plans to expand Jewish settlements in Israel, which have been widely criticized in Germany and throughout Europe; insists that Israel and Germany remain close friends despite disagreements.

byline.contributor: Steven Erlanger contributed reporting from Jerusalem.

lead_paragraph: Benjamin Netanyahu, the Israeli prime minister, said Israel and Germany remained close friends despite their disagreement over the settlements.

headline.seo: Netanyahu, in Germany, Defends Settlement Plans
headline.main: Netanyahu, in Visit to Germany, Defends Settlement Plans
headline.print_headline: Netanyahu, in Visit to Germany, Defends Settlement Plans
